body_html:
System details : ubuntu 14.04 x86_64
Tensorflow version: 0.10.0

I installed it as binary
i.e i followed this - >

# Ubuntu/Linux 64-bit, GPU enabled, Python 2.7
# Requires CUDA toolkit 7.5 and CuDNN v5. For other versions, see "Install from sources" below.
$ export TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

 sudo pip install --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL

I just found out its due to Session() as i tried basic program i.e

`>>> import tensorflow as tf

hello = tf.constant('Hello, TensorFlow!')
sess = tf.Session()`

I am using tensorflow cpu version as of now since gpu dint work. I am able to train my model with the same. But I would really appreciate if you could please help me with gpu version

Thanks!

 sudo pip install --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL


I just found out its due to Session() as i tried basic program i.e

hello = tf.constant('Hello, TensorFlow!')
sess = tf.Session()`



I am using tensorflow cpu version as of now since gpu dint work. I am able to train my model with the same. But I would really appreciate if you could please help me with gpu version
Thanks!
body:
**System details** : ubuntu 14.04 x86_64 
**Tensorflow version:** 0.10.0

I installed it as binary 
i.e i followed this - > 

```
# Ubuntu/Linux 64-bit, GPU enabled, Python 2.7
# Requires CUDA toolkit 7.5 and CuDNN v5. For other versions, see "Install from sources" below.
$ export TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

 sudo pip install --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL

```
I just found out its due to **Session()** as i tried basic program i.e 

`>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> hello = tf.constant('Hello, TensorFlow!')
>>> sess = tf.Session()`

 
I am using tensorflow cpu version as of now since gpu dint work. I am able to train my model with the same. But I would really appreciate if you could please help me with gpu version 


Thanks!
